ratings.comment: He is online-challenged and had many issues with posting lectures on the date assigned. Many of the assignments did not have clear instructions or explained what the assignment was for. Very little feedback and lectures had little to no applicable content if you are not an econ major.
He was awesome! super great lectures, a real gem and a half

He's a very nice professor and cares a lot about the material, but his lectures tend to drag on and he rambles a bit making class a bit boring. There are very few assignments put in and only two exams which are not very challenging. It's his first time teaching this class so he may improve if he teaches it again

I really enjoyed learning from Professor Coxhead.  Came into this class with limited interest in the subject area, but his passion for the subject soon rubs off on you.  Lots of reading, but not an overly difficult class.  More theoreticalhistorical than most economics classes, something that was a nice change.  I definitely recommend him.

What a great guy! Best professor at uw madison that I've ever had. Not the easiest class you'll take but by all means, completely doable and reasonable. But please, go to class. The guy is so nice and he honestly wants everyone to learn and actually care.

Easily the best Econ professor ever. He explains concepts well, provides excellent, relevant readings instead of a boring textbook like most classes. He's also very nice during his flexible office hours, very accommodating and helpful. Has a good sense of humor too, always very jovial. Take this class!!
One of the best teachers I've had at Madison hands down. Great lecturer. Decent amount of work, but you learn a lot. Take this class
Tests are a bit difficult. Great and timely at answering any questions you may have. Recommend this class if you are more into theory rather than calculations.

Great instructor with a good sense of humor. Very helpful and responds quickly to e-mails. Grade consists of: Two exams, 2 smaller papers, a presentation and a larger research paper. very interesting class.
